page.title: 03THE CHURCH IN LITTONDALE
page.content: The Church is called St. Oswald's. St. Oswald was the King of Northumbria. There used to be a church here, thought to be made of wood, in Saxon times. Nothing remains of this wooden church. All that remains from the Norman period are the foundations under the present chancel. The Tower is all that is left of a 15th Century church. Most of the rest of the present building dates from the end of the 18th Century. Early in the 19th Century part of the nave was knocked down so that the chancel could be built. Two well known Vicars of Arncliffe church in the 19th Century were William Boyd and Cannon Shuffrey. There is no resident vicar at Arncliffe now, the Vicar of Kettlewell is also Vicar of Arncliffe.
